programme.title: 2024 Men's College World Series
programme.desc: Tennessee and Texas A&M face off in Game 1 of the MCWS championship series. The No. 1 Vols went 58-12 this season, while the No. 4 Aggies played their way to a 52-13 mark.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Formula One drivers begin their European summer with the Spanish Grand Prix. Max Verstappen won this event the last two years after Lewis Hamilton's run of five straight. Fernando Alonso (2006, 2013) is the only Spaniard to win this race.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: From Red Bull Arena in Harrison, N.J.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: WNBA news, analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Fever travel to play the Sky as Caitlin Clark versus Angel Reese round three begins. Clark's Indiana side won the first two meetings, with the Iowa standout falling two rebounds and one assist shy of a triple-double in the 91-83 decision June 16.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Luis Severino seeks another strong result against the Cubs his Mets finish a set with the Cubs. Severino shut Chicago down on April 29, taking a no-hitter into the eighth inning and allowing just one run, but ultimately was handed a no-decision.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: 2024 Men's College World Series
programme.desc: Either Tennessee or Texas A&M will be crowned the NCAA baseball national champions for 2024. For either team, it would be their first overall title.

programme.title: 2024 Stanley Cup Final
programme.desc: The Oilers try to complete a historic comeback in Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Final against the Panthers. Only one team has previously overturned a 3-0 deficit to lift the Cup, when the Toronto Maple Leafs upended the Detroit Red Wings in 1942.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Whittaker vs. Aliskerov
programme.desc: Shara Magomedov vs. Joilton Lutterbach, middleweight; Kelvin Gastelum vs. Daniel Rodriguez, middleweight; Sergei Pavlovich vs. Alexander Volkov, heavyweight; Robert Whittaker vs. Ikram Aliskerov, middleweight. From Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Butch Reynolds' relentless battle to clear his name reveals systemic flaws within sports governance and the enduring impact of false accusations on an athlete's legacy. As the documentary makes clear, the real truth is found beyond the headlines.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: On June 15, 2011, Vancouver hosts Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals between the Canucks and Boston Bruins; the city is a hive of nervous energy with the home team on the verge of its first-ever title, but when Boston stuns the Canucks to win the Cup, the situation quickly devolves into a full-blown riot, an orgy of violence that sees cars overturned and burned, windows shattered, businesses looted, and lawlessness reign... as hundreds of cell phone cameras capture it all.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: 37 Words
programme.desc: In the 1970s, buoyed by Title IX, the first generation of the new legislation's beneficiaries work to turn its lofty legal language into a reality. At times at great personal cost, these women transform the promise of 37 words into true progress.

programme.title: 37 Words
programme.desc: After a generation of Title IX, women who've had the doors of opportunity opened to them become stars who win Olympic gold medals and World Cups, persevering past discrimination to inspire young girls and boys alike and create even more change.

programme.title: 37 Words
programme.desc: Fifty years after Title IX was passed, the fight continues for equality on and off the field. Now, the next generation has taken the mantle in the ongoing quest for justice.

programme.title: Cheerleading
programme.desc: Coverage of competitive cheerleading events.

programme.title: 2024 AKC Disc Dog Challenge
programme.desc: Top canine athletes, and their owners, compete in flying disc games to determine a champion.

programme.desc: From Boston.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: A unique blend of NBA opinions, stats, culture, and a fresh narrative to the game we love. Four lifelong friends talk all things basketball from every angle, on and off the court.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: Athletes Unlimited Pro Softball AUX
programme.desc: From Wilkins Stadium in Wichita, Kan.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Türkiye is up against Portugal in Dortmund in Group F of the 2024 European Championships. Portugal won all three EUROs matches versus Türkiye: 1-0 in the EURO 1996 group stage, 2-0 in the EURO 2000 quarter-finals and 2-0 in the EURO 2008 group stage.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Belgium contests Romania in Cologne in Group E of EURO 2024. The only competitive meetings were in 1994 World Cup qualifying. Belgium won 1-0 in Brussels (goal by Rudy Smidts) and Romania won 2-1 in Bucharest (home goals by Raducioiu and Dumitrescu).

programme.desc: Scotland plays Hungary in Stuttgart in Group A of the 2024 European Championships. This is the first competitive game between the teams. The most recent meeting was a 1-0 friendly win for Scotland in Budapest in March 2018 (goal by Matthew Phillips).

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Switzerland takes on Germany in Frankfurt am Main in Group A of the 2024 European Championships. This is the first EUROs meeting. They last met at a major tournament when West Germany beat the Swiss 5-0 in Sheffield in the 1966 World Cup group stage.

programme.title: Golf PGA Tour
programme.desc: La temporada del PGA Tour termina con la ronda final del Travelers Championship, el último evento emblemático de 2024. Arnold Palmer ganó este torneo dos veces en un desempate, mientras que Billy Casper, ganador de tres majors, es tetracampeón.

programme.title: Final de la Copa Stanley 2024
